strategy: Apply a robust feature engineering pipeline: create new features such as 'FamilySize' (SibSp + Parch + 1), 'IsAlone' (1 if FamilySize == 1), and 'AgeGroup' (categorized into bins like 0–10, 11–20, etc.). Use target encoding for categorical variables like 'Embarked' and 'Pclass' by encoding them with the mean survival rate. Then train a simple logistic regression model with L1 regularization to achieve interpretability and strong performance on sparse features.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Create new features
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Age grouping
age_bins = [0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 100]
age_labels = ['0-10', '11-20', '21-30', '31-40', '41+']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Target encoding for categorical variables
# Encode 'Embarked' with mean survival rate
embarked_survival = train_df.groupby('Embarked')['Survived'].mean()
train_df['Embarked_Targ'] = train_df['Embarked'].map(embarked_survival).fillna(0)
test_df['Embarked_Targ'] = test_df['Embarked'].map(embarked_survival).fillna(0)

# Encode 'Pclass' with mean survival rate
pclass_survival = train_df.groupby('Pclass')['Survived'].mean()
train_df['Pclass_Targ'] = train_df['Pclass'].map(pclass_survival).fillna(0)
test_df['Pclass_Targ'] = test_df['Pclass'].map(pclass_survival).fillna(0)

# Encode 'AgeGroup' with mean survival rate
agegroup_survival = train_df.groupby('AgeGroup')['Survived'].mean()
train_df['AgeGroup_Targ'] = train_df['AgeGroup'].map(agegroup_survival).fillna(0)
test_df['AgeGroup_Targ'] = test_df['AgeGroup'].map(agegroup_survival).fillna(0)

# Drop original categorical columns and create feature matrix
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# One-hot encode

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Create new features
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Age grouping
age_bins = [0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 100]
age_labels = ['0-10', '11-20', '21-30', '31-40', '41+']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Drop irrelevant columns
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Convert to numeric and fill NaN
X_train = X_train.astype(float)
X_test = X_test.astype(float)

# Fill any remaining NaN values
X_train = X_train.fillna(X_train.median(numeric_only=True))
X_test = X_test.fillna(X_test.median(numeric_only=True))

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Create new features
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Age grouping
age_bins = [0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 100]
age_labels = ['0-10', '11-20', '21-30', '31-40', '41+']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Fill missing values in numeric columns only
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numeric_columns:
    train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].median(), inplace=True)
    test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Drop irrelevant columns
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Select only numeric columns for modeling
X_train_numeric = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])
X_test_numeric = X_test.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])

# Fill missing values in numeric features
X_train_numeric = X_train_numeric.fillna(X_train_numeric.median())
X_test_numeric = X_test_numeric.fillna(X_test_numeric.median())

# Normalize features
scale

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Create new features
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Age grouping
age_bins = [0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 100]
age_labels = ['0-10', '11-20', '21-30', '31-40', '41+']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Fill missing values in numeric columns only
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numeric_columns:
    train_df[col] = train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].median())
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].median())

# Drop irrelevant columns
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['AgeGroup', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Select only numeric columns for modeling
X_train_numeric = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])
X_test_numeric = X_test.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])

# Fill missing values in numeric features
X_train_numeric = X_train_numeric.fillna(X_train_numeric.median())
X_test_numeric = X_test_numeric.fillna(X_test_numeric.median())

# Normalize features
sc
